title: macOS: Spack Quickstart
body:
My colleague is a physicist and because they are living in CA, decided to get a Mac because that's hip and cool. Their colleague Axel told them "use Spack, it provides all you'll ever need!", so they followed the [quickstart](https://spack.io/about/#install-spack) guide:

```
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack install hdf5
```

They did not succeed because they don't have Fortran compilers yet.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Following the commands above, a typical Mac user, but also all people working with freshly installed Linux distributions will try to install the hdf5 package. The hdf5 package implicitly depends on `+mpi` which concretizes to `openmpi` which depends on a fortran compiler.

Long story short: if people use Spack to install HPC software, e.g. for local development on their laptops, then they will need either directly or transitively MPI packages to compile. If `+mpi` is the default in spack, then so is a dependency on a Fortran compiler. Even our default example `spack install hdf5` shows that. Fortran compilers are not available on default systems and most software does not need it, we just pull it through MPI.

Should we extend our quickstart guide to bootstrap a full GCC?
Should we extend our docs of [core dependencies](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/getting_started.html)?
The long-term solution is probably to fix the variants of virtual dependencies to allow a Fortran-free build of most things that don't actually need it?

### Error Message

```
...
==> No patches needed for openmpi
==> Building openmpi [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Error: InstallError: OpenMPI requires both C and Fortran compilers!

/home/vsts/work/1/s/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openmpi/package.py:385, in die_without_fortran:
        382        # avoid delayed build errors in dependents.
        383        if (self.compiler.f77 is None) or (self.compiler.fc is None):
        384            raise InstallError(
  >>    385                'OpenMPI requires both C and Fortran compilers!'
        386            )
```


### Information on your system

Try the quick-start guide with any fresh system, such as
- any cloud instance, e.g. Azure for macOS
- any newly bought Mac with Xcode in place
- a freshly installed Ubuntu
